alert.note: Alert for Amador; El Dorado; Placer; Sacramento; Yolo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 1:10PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Placer. In northern California, Amador, El Dorado, Sacramento and Yolo. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Periods of moderate to heavy rain will continue to bring localized roadway flooding and rises on local streams and creeks through the evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sacramento, Elk Grove, Roseville, Citrus Heights, Folsom, Rocklin, Auburn, Placerville, El Dorado Hills, Fair Oaks, Cameron Park, Carmichael, Rancho Cordova, West Sacramento, Loomis, Rancho Murieta, Natomas, Orangevale, Gold River and Granite Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Amador; El Dorado; Placer; Sacramento; Yolo
